bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, January 17, 1899
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D FEB 20 '99 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: No. 16 Consulate Series. Legation of the United States Monrovia Liberia, Jan. 17, 1899.

p.add: CONSULAR BUREAU FEB 24 1899 Department of State.

div1.p: Sir: I have the honor to transmit to you the intelligence, that I have herewith transmitted, to the Secretary of State a Photograph of United States Legation at Monrovia.
As the second floor of the Legation is not occupied, neither as officials nor archives of the Legation, I do hereby ask permission to occupy it as a resident for the Minister and his family.
I have the honor to be your obedient servant Owen L. W. Smith To Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State

Inclosures. 1 Letter-Philadelphia Cour Messurs Philadelphia. 1. "The Defiance Machine Works" Defiance Ohio 1. S. B. Spring & Bro. Leather M'fg Co. Belleville N.J. 1. Deckinson, & Co, #10 Wall St New York. Note of Advice relative to said letters.
